title: Adult Social Care All-Party Parliamentary Group
purpose: To be part of the solution for finding a sustainable social care model; build a positive cross-party vision for the future for social care; unlock Parliament to the social care sector, and open the doors of social care to local MPs; be led by lived experience and championed by parliamentarians.

contact_details.registered_contact_address: House of Commons, London, SW1A 0AA. Tel: 020 7219 4535.
contact_details.public_enquiry_point_name: Matthew Spencer, Healthcomms Consulting Ltd. Tel: 07768 601822
contact_details.secretariat: Healthcomms Consulting Ltd acts as the group's secretariat.https://www.healthcommsconsulting.co.uk/

detailed_benefits.Source: Healthcomms Consulting Ltd (part of the PLMR Group)
detailed_benefits.Description: Healthcomms Consulting Ltd is paid by the following to act as the group's secretariat: National Care Forum, Social Care Institute for Excellence, Home Group, MHA, Affinity Trust, Skills for Care, Community Integrated Care, CareTech, Anchor, Sanctuary, Dimensions, United Response, Learning Disability England, Nourish Care, Achieve Together. From : 16/10/2024 To  : 15/10/2025

detailed_benefits.Source: Healthcomms Consulting Ltd (part of the PLMR Group)
detailed_benefits.Description: Healthcomms Consulting Ltd meets the cost of lived experience and events for the APPG and is funded by the following to do so: National Care Forum, Social Care Institute for Excellence, Home Group, MHA, Affinity Trust, Skills for Care, Community Integrated Care, Care Tech, Anchor, Sanctuary, Dimensions, United Response, Learning Disability England, Achieve Together. From : 16/10/2024 To  : 15/10/2025
